channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Street Light Not Working, 23rd August
item.description:
The street lamp outside 7-8 Coniston Walk has not been working for several months. This means that the area is very dark in the evening and night time. This is not safe for people on there way home in the area as it creates a very large dark spot.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Coniston Walk, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous low hanging branches, 23rd August
item.description:
Low hanging branches from a leaning tree over the path. The canopy forms a natural archway but some branches dip low which is very dangerous, particularly from the weight of the tree. There is also lots of wood debris in the brook which needs clearing or otherwise will cause the brook to block and flood.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sparrow Drive, Crofton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Since 7th Aug!!! Leaning bus stop/ smashed car/graffitti/ litter/ no access to public pathway, 23rd August
item.description:
This is getting a bit ridiculous- since 7th Aug on this main road there is a crashed car taking up whole of pathway/ bus stop is damaged and leaning/ graffitti/ pedestrians are unable to walk on path and have to walk on main road/ smashed glass/ dumping of rubbish behind and around bus stop……. Surely it doesn’t take more than two weeks to make it safe for all… also the speed of traffic between the Aldi to the Penge high street traffic lights is too fast hence probably what this car crash is. We need speed bumps…. The road is unable to take the heavy electric busses that go by as several neighbours experience their properties shake …. This issue has been ongoing for many years and the council always say check your own building and not take a close look at their roads - which have been dug up and sealed several times in the past decade…. Pay attention to the junction of Melvin road / Croydon road with heavy electric busses ( I noted the 358 always and at night especially when traffic is particular fast) travelling north to high street - as bus goes over that area the houses tremble. I hope this mess will be cleared soon to make it safe for the Penge residents.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 61-63, Croydon Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Council tree on verge outside 34 Midfield Way, 23rd August

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34, Midfield Way, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: 60 cm wide 5 cm deep sink hole outside no 27 the vale, 23rd August
item.description:
I reported this sinkhole to Barnet a month ago and they immediately acknowledged the problem and fixed it within 48 hrs. A month on unfortunately the sink hole has reappeared in exactly the same place. Barnet are now telling me the damage is not severe enough to warrant fixing yet it is exactly the same as it was before and the huge volume of double deckers buses and trucks that zoom past on a regular basis makes my whole house physically jump and is causing some distress to my children let alone the damage being caused to the property itself.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Vale, Golders Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet
